ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] URI always a URL?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I could be mistaken, but I thought the format of a URN was different than a URL, thus a URL used as a name is not a URN, but it is strictly a URI.

On Fri, Jul 9, 2010 at 5:23 AM, Sean Kennedy <seandkennedy@...>wrote:

>
> Hi Eric,
>     Thanks for that. Is this correct : the string e.g. "
> http://www.example.org/somepath", when used as an identifier for resources
> e.g. RDF or for identifying namespaces, is in fact a URN (and thus a URI)
> because it is not a location that one would type into a browser
> (dereference)?
>
>
I could be mistaken, but I thought the format of a URN was different than a
URL, thus a URL used as a name is not a URN, but it is strictly a URI.
(Wikipedia
reference <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_Resource_Name#URN_Syntax> for
URN schema.)

Ryan Riley

--000e0cd305d40b52dd048af66165
